title.narrative: Private Sector Programme in southern Serbia

description.narrative: The production of fruits and berries (especially plums, sour cherries and raspberries) is essential for employment and income in the relatively poor southern part of Serbia. However rapidly increasing global competition combined with a lack of quality threatens the livelihood of all participants in these value chains. Therefore support is provided in southern Serbia to improve the efficiency of production and marketing of fruits and berries. A strong need has been identified to enhance the quality of primary production through better protection against plant diseases and assistance to grow and process fruit and berries in accordance with the EU rules on food safety and quality control. The main objective of the support is to contribute to sustainable economic growth and employment in the private sector in southern Serbia through enhanced productivity, competitiveness and exports in the fruit and berries value chains. The support consist of two components: (1) capacity-building of primary producers/businesses, including support for innovation, quality assurance and certification and (2) a matching grant facility to finance investments in fruit and berry orchards and introduction of new varieties, equipment, storage, processing and marketing. The Serbian government co-finances the grant facility with EUR 3.3 million.
